ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.9'

about.description:
Data Morph transforms an input dataset of 2D points into select shapes,
while preserving the summary statistics to a given number of decimal
points through simulated annealing. It is intended to be used as a
teaching tool to illustrate the importance of data visualization.
about.summary: Teaching tool on the importance of data visualization.

about.description:
Data Morph transforms an input dataset of 2D points into select shapes,
while preserving the summary statistics to a given number of decimal
points through simulated annealing. It is intended to be used as a
teaching tool to illustrate the importance of data visualization.
about.summary: Teaching tool on the importance of data visualization.

name: data-morph-ai
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "data-morph-ai" %}
{% set version = "0.3.1" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name.replace('-', '_') }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 721761e995895ec33f39e71581c8a3a58e76056f84d0f4b2a064fa3987f6557e

build:
  entry_points:
    - data-morph = data_morph.cli:main
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - setuptools
    - setuptools-scm
    - pip
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - matplotlib-base >=3.7
    - numpy >=1.20
    - pandas >=1.2
    - rich >=13.9.4

test:
  imports:
    - data_morph
  commands:
    - pip check
    - data-morph --help
  requires:
    - pip
    - python {{ python_min }}

about:
  summary: Teaching tool on the importance of data visualization.
  home: https://stefaniemolin.com/data-morph
  dev_url: https://github.com/stefmolin/data-morph
  doc_url: https://stefaniemolin.com/data-morph
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  description: |
    Data Morph transforms an input dataset of 2D points into select shapes,
    while preserving the summary statistics to a given number of decimal
    points through simulated annealing. It is intended to be used as a
    teaching tool to illustrate the importance of data visualization.

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - stefmolin
